page.title: 15VILLAGE CONCERNS
page.content:
THERE ARE TWO INTERLINKED CAUSES FOR CONCERN IN THE VILLAGE. ONE IS THE PLAN TO BUILD NEW HOUSES IN SEVERAL PARTS OF THE VILLAGE. AGREEMENT IS NOT UNIVERSAL OVER THE SITING OF SOME OF THESE. THE ALLOTMENTS, WHICH ARE WELL ESTABLISHED, MAY HAVE TO BE GIVEN UP AND NEW ONES STARTED.NEW SEWERAGE IS NEEDED BEFORE BUILDING CAN BEGIN.
THE OTHER IS THE FALL IN THE NUMBER OF YOUNG CHILDREN IN THE VILLAGE THUS MAKING THE FUTURE OF THE VILLAGE SCHOOL UNCERTAIN. IT IS HOPED THAT THE NEW HOUSES WILL BRING YOUNG FAMILIES TO INCREASE THE NUMBERS OF SCHOOL CHILDREN.
